text: The Port Hills Fault is an inferred active seismic fault believed to be located beneath the Port Hills near Christchurch, on the east coast of New Zealand's South Island. == Christchurch earthquake == A 6.3-magnitude earthquake occurred on the Port Hills Fault at on local time (23:51 UTC),M6.3 – South Island of New Zealand , USGS causing widespread damage and fatalities. The earthquake was centred west of the town of Lyttelton, and south-east of the centre of Christchurch, New Zealand's second-most populous city. It followed nearly six months after the 7.1 magnitude 2010 Canterbury earthquake that caused significant damage to the region but no direct fatalities. ==References== Category:Seismic faults of New Zealand Category:2011 Christchurch earthquake
title: Port Hills Fault
